app.title: ClarityAge - 40
app.description: Explore philosophical questions and personal values
app.welcome: Welcome to your React + Material-UI application

contact.title: Contact

viteReact.description: Built with Vite for fast development and hot module replacement. TypeScript support included.

readyToBuild.title: Ready to Build
readyToBuild.description: Start building your application with modern React patterns and Material-UI components.

q1.title: Enlightened Mortality: Time as the Ultimate Currency
q1.description: Instead of fear - gratitude. Limited time stops being a threat and becomes life's priority algorithm. You stop being 'managed by the calendar' - you manage your existence through conscious choices.
q1.quote: We don't have too little time, but we waste much of it.
q1.author: Seneca
q1.question: I feel that the way I spend my time reflects its true value.

q2.title: The Enough™ Principle 2.0
q2.description: You don't just distinguish wants from needs - you redefine success. You abandon the illusion of 'more' in favor of life architecture that's balanced, elegant, and functional. Comfort, not consumption.
q2.quote: The things you own end up owning you.
q2.author: Tyler Durden (Fight Club)
q2.question: I believe that what I desire will actually contribute to my peace.

q3.title: Energy Management, Not Time Management
q3.description: You don't plan your day based on the clock, but on your biological rhythms. You act in moments of power and regenerate during downturns - achieving more while burning out less.
q3.quote: We're not tired from work, we're tired from doing meaningless things.
q3.author: Greg McKeown
q3.question: I feel that my actions are synchronized with my natural energy.

q4.title: The Art of Sacred NO
q4.description: Every YES is a commitment. That's why your most powerful strategy becomes refusal - calm, guilt-free, full of clarity. You protect space for what truly matters.
q4.quote: Boundaries are not a wall - they're a gateway with selective access.
q4.author: Brené Brown
q4.question: I can firmly and calmly refuse when something doesn't serve my priorities.

q5.title: Earn Wisely, Not More
q5.description: Your financial maturity isn't about impressive income, but conscious choices. Money becomes a tool of freedom, not spectacle.
q5.quote: It's not wealth that makes you free, but how you use it.
q5.author: Morgan Housel
q5.question: I feel that my financial decisions increase my freedom.

q6.title: Body as Capital
q6.description: After forty, the body doesn't forgive as much as it used to - but in return for care, it repays with longevity, strength, and mental clarity. It's not punishment - it's investment logic.
q6.quote: Your health is what you invest, not what just happens.
q6.author: Peter Attia
q6.question: I care for my body as capital that compounds in the future.

q7.title: Relationships of Reciprocity
q7.description: You don't maintain relationships out of habit. Your social energy is limited - you allocate it where there's exchange, not one-sided consumption.
q7.quote: Not everyone who was part of your past needs to be part of your future.
q7.author: Trent Shelton
q7.question: I maintain relationships that are mutual and supportive.

q8.title: Experience Capital
q8.description: Your mistakes, lessons, failures - they're currency today. You teach, mentor, design better because your knowledge is based on reality, not theory.
q8.quote: Experience is the name we give to our mistakes.
q8.author: Oscar Wilde
q8.question: I can leverage my experiences as an advantage.

q9.title: Emotional Radar
q9.description: You see who feeds and who drains. Your emotional intelligence is an early warning system - and a shield. You're calmer because you don't let chaos inside.
q9.quote: People aren't toxic - but their behaviors can be lethally contagious.
q9.author: Susan David
q9.question: I can recognize and protect myself from emotional chaos.

q10.title: Legacy Thinking
q10.description: Instead of asking 'what have I achieved?', you ask 'what will remain after me?'. It's not about monuments - it's about lasting impact that survives your presence.
q10.quote: Plant trees under which you'll never sit.
q10.author: Greek maxim
q10.question: I feel I'm building something that will outlast me and have value for others.

q11.title: Systems, Not Parts
q11.description: Your life stops being a collection of separate projects - it becomes an ecosystem. Work supports health, health supports relationships, relationships support mission.
q11.quote: Only when everything plays together does life play your melody.
q11.author: James Clear
q11.question: My life actions support each other and create a coherent system.

q12.title: Joy of Integration
q12.description: It's not perfection, but coherence that brings satisfaction. For the first time, you feel that life doesn't have to be a compromise - it can be a whole where everything has its place.
q12.quote: When every part of your life plays on the same team, you start winning.
q12.author: Cal Newport
q12.question: I feel that my life is coherent and integrated.
